meanings.definition: Able to be excluded or kept out.
meanings.sent1: The VIP section was excludable to the general public.
meanings.sent2: The private event was excludable to those without invitations.
meanings.sent3: It's like having a secret club that is excludable to everyone else.
meanings.sent4: The fortress had an excludable entrance, keeping intruders at bay.
meanings.sent5: The exclusive club had an excludable membership, ensuring only the elite could join.

meanings.definition: Subject to being left out or omitted.
meanings.sent1: Her name was excludable from the list of participants.
meanings.sent2: The optional activities were excludable from the itinerary.
meanings.sent3: The missing puzzle piece was excludable from the completed picture.
meanings.sent4: His absence made him feel excludable from the group.
meanings.sent5: The extra toppings were excludable from the basic pizza order.
